meanings.definition: Having a strong desire or determination to do something.
meanings.sent1: She was willinger than ever to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The team was willinger to win the championship this year.
meanings.sent3: His willinger attitude towards exercise surprised his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her willinger spirit shone brightly during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's willinger behavior made training sessions more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: More willing or eager to do something.
meanings.sent1: He felt willinger to help his friend after hearing about the situation.
meanings.sent2: The students were willinger to participate in the science experiment.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed willinger than usual to play with its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden looked willinger after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The children's willinger expressions brightened up the room.
